content.question: Instant ardentes Tyrii, pars ducere muros, molirique arcem et manibus subvolvere saxa, pars optare locum tecto et concludere sulco. Iura magistratusque legunt sanctumque senatum; 5hic portus alii effodiunt; hic alta theatris fundamenta locant alii, immanesque columnas rupibus excidunt, scaenis decora alta futuris. Aeneid 1. 423-429 Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. What happened earlier in Book 1 that explains why the Tyrians do not realize that Aeneas is watching them? 2. (A) Identify two Latin verbs in this passage that indicate that the Tyrians are constructing defensive fortifications and (B) translate them in context with their direct objects. 3. In this passage, (A) which three Latin words identify the government that the Tyrians are establishing? (B) Translate these words in context. 4. What are the case and number of alta (line 5) ? 5. Which one Latin word in this passage is the subject of locant (line 6) ? 6. (A) Identify the case and use of rupibus (line 7) and (B) translate it in context. 7. In lines 6-7 (fundamenta . . . futuris), identify three accusative nouns. 8. In lines 6-7 (fundamenta . . . futuris), which two Latin words indicate that they aspire to having theater productions in this city? 9. (A) Name one and only one literary device found in line 7 (rupibus . . . futuris) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it.
